intro: Geonoma maxima subsp. compta, commonly known as the broad-leafed arrowroot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, strap-like leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. It produces small, clustered white flowers that are often hidden among the foliage. This species is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
